===Late January 2011===
===Late January 2011===

+
[[File:110109 Algeria slashes food prices amid riots 001.jpg|thumb|Protesters]]
A number of left-wing opposition parties, including the [[Socialist Forces Front|FFS]], RCD, [[Party of Liberty and Justice|PLJ]], and the Communist [[Democratic and Social Movement (Algeria)|MDS]], as well as the [[Algerian League for Human Rights]] (LADDH) and officially unrecognised unions, such as SATEF and SNAPAP, met on 20 January to discuss responses to the situation. On 21 January, several of them (excluding the FFS<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ffs1963.unblog.fr/2011/01/22/le-ffs-estime-que-la-concertation-doit-sapprofondir-et-eventuellement-selargir-a-lavenir/ |title=''Le FFS estime que la concertation doit sâapprofondir et Ã©ventuellement sâÃ©largir Ã  lâavenir'', 22/01/2011 |publisher=Ffs1963.unblog.fr |date= |accessdate=2011-02-01}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dna-algerie.com/politique/42-interieure/1200-le-ffs-de-hocine-ait-ahmed-demande-une-autorisation-pour-un-meeting-a-bab-el-oued-alger.html |title=DNA AlgÃ©rie, 23/01/2011, ''Le FFS de Hocine Ait Ahmed demande une autorisation pour un meeting Ã  Bab El Oued (Alger)'' |publisher=Dna-algerie.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-01}}</ref>) formed the [[Coordination Nationale pour le Changement et la DÃ©mocratie]] (National Coordination for Change and Democracy), seeking systemic change within the country<ref name="afrik"/> and calling (along with [[Rachad]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rachad.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=604&catid=69&Itemid=101 |title=Rachad, ''Appel Ã  des manifestations pour les droits et libertÃ©s en AlgÃ©rie'' |publisher=Rachad.org |date= |accessdate=2011-02-01}}</ref>) for nationwide marches, starting 9 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.biladi.fr/011168180-marches-prevues-le-9-fevrier-partis-et-syndicats-sagitent |title=Biladi, 21/01/2011, ''AlgÃ©rie : Marches prÃ©vues le 9 fÃ©vrier - Partis et syndicats s'agitent'' |publisher=Biladi.fr |date= |accessdate=2011-02-01}}</ref> The Interior Minister, Ould Kablia, responded that "No march would be authorised by the authorities in Algiers... Marches are forbidden in Algiers."<ref> {{cite web
A number of left-wing opposition parties, including the [[Socialist Forces Front|FFS]], RCD, [[Party of Liberty and Justice|PLJ]], and the Communist [[Democratic and Social Movement (Algeria)|MDS]], as well as the [[Algerian League for Human Rights]] (LADDH) and officially unrecognised unions, such as SATEF and SNAPAP, met on 20 January to discuss responses to the situation. On 21 January, several of them (excluding the FFS<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ffs1963.unblog.fr/2011/01/22/le-ffs-estime-que-la-concertation-doit-sapprofondir-et-eventuellement-selargir-a-lavenir/ |title=''Le FFS estime que la concertation doit sâapprofondir et Ã©ventuellement sâÃ©largir Ã  lâavenir'', 22/01/2011 |publisher=Ffs1963.unblog.fr |date= |accessdate=2011-02-01}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dna-algerie.com/politique/42-interieure/1200-le-ffs-de-hocine-ait-ahmed-demande-une-autorisation-pour-un-meeting-a-bab-el-oued-alger.html |title=DNA AlgÃ©rie, 23/01/2011, ''Le FFS de Hocine Ait Ahmed demande une autorisation pour un meeting Ã  Bab El Oued (Alger)'' |publisher=Dna-algerie.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-01}}</ref>) formed the [[Coordination Nationale pour le Changement et la DÃ©mocratie]] (National Coordination for Change and Democracy), seeking systemic change within the country<ref name="afrik"/> and calling (along with [[Rachad]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rachad.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=604&catid=69&Itemid=101 |title=Rachad, ''Appel Ã  des manifestations pour les droits et libertÃ©s en AlgÃ©rie'' |publisher=Rachad.org |date= |accessdate=2011-02-01}}</ref>) for nationwide marches, starting 9 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.biladi.fr/011168180-marches-prevues-le-9-fevrier-partis-et-syndicats-sagitent |title=Biladi, 21/01/2011, ''AlgÃ©rie : Marches prÃ©vues le 9 fÃ©vrier - Partis et syndicats s'agitent'' |publisher=Biladi.fr |date= |accessdate=2011-02-01}}</ref> The Interior Minister, Ould Kablia, responded that "No march would be authorised by the authorities in Algiers... Marches are forbidden in Algiers."<ref> {{cite web
